title: had an afk from the start and couldn't surrender early?
body:
The person was trying to reconnect but he was basically afk entire time, 0 cs 0/0/0 level 1. 17 minutes in now... what's the deal? why can't we surrender early and not lose lp and time? (was trying since before minute 3)

Doesn't this defeat the whole point of implementing this?

replies.body:
Here are the conditions for /remake to work

>- UPDATED: If any player is dc’d or flagged afk for at least 90 seconds at the three minute mark, a /remake is available

>- UPDATED: A first blood against a player’s team before they leave/dc prevents a remake vote

>- All players on that team have one minute to prompt a vote by typing /remake in chat

>- The vote needs at least two of four players (30% of players in game) to agree, at which point the game ends

>- All players connected to the game basically pretend the game never happened, gaining or losing no LP/IP/XP, and seeing no change to their overall W/L records

>- The dc’d player (or players) takes full LP losses or drop a promo game, and are also flagged by Leaver Buster

>- Note for ranked: To protect competitive integrity, Diamond V and above players will also take a loss when the dc’d player is in their premade; We’ll keep an eye on this restriction to see if it needs to extend to lower ranks


Basically, they have to be AFK for 90 seconds by the 3 minute mark without any deaths on your team for /remake to work

[Source](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/player-behavior/play-games-matter/remake)
seems flawed.. just because they were trying to reconnect that we can't surrender no?
I think because they "reconnected" they come out of the AFK status.
This is correct, if they reconnect past the 90 second mark you are stuck in the game, if they reconnect and afk at the 80 second mark, then you can still make the vote.
Seems a little bugged, I played a game yesterday where a player was afk and we got first blood and they still remade, still needs some tweaking I think
If the player is afk before the first blood, it doesn't matter.
